programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the 2002 AFC Championship matchup between the Tennessee Titans and the Oakland Raiders where Tennessee found themselves unable to contend with a lethal Raiders passing attack led by Rich Gannon and a defensive unit that repeatedly put the Titans in uncomfortable situations. The big win gave the Raiders a ticket to their fifth Super Bowl appearance.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Ricky Williams runs for 119 yards, and three touchdowns as Dolphins top Panthers.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Donavan McNabb finishes with 191 yards and Brian Westbrook gains 131 yards on the day when Philadelphia Eagles end the New York Giants' seven-game winning streak.

programme.desc: From All-Pros to MVPs and Super Bowl champions, NFL Throwback takes a deep dive into the most underrated players in history.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: After a brilliant career at Ohio State and with the Tennessee Titans, Eddie George starts acting for himself.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The Tennessee Titans didn't need another miracle. They just needed Eddie George, their defense and some help from instant replay. George scored on a 68-yard run on the third play of the second half Sunday to lead the Titans to a 19-16 victory over the Indianapolis Colts and a trip to Jacksonville for the AFC title game.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Relive the 1996 AFC Divisional Round matchup between the Jacksonville Jaguars and the Denver Broncos where the Broncos were tied for NFL high in regular season wins with 13 and led by future Hall of Fame quarterback, John Elway. Jacksonville did not let any of that faze them, as they pulled off one of the greatest upsets in NFL history.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: From All-Pros to MVPs and Super Bowl champions, NFL Throwback takes a deep dive into the most underrated players in history.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: From All-Pros to MVPs and Super Bowl champions, NFL Throwback takes a deep dive into the most underrated players in history.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classics
programme.desc: St. Louis Rams linebacker Mike Jones makes a game-saving tackle on the 1-yard line as time expires, preserving the Rams' first-ever Super Bowl title. From Jan. 30, 2000 at the Georgia Dome in Atlanta.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classics
programme.desc: This game features two teams ending long Super Bowl appearance droughts as well as Lovie Smith and Tony Dungy being the first black head coaches to coach in the Super Bowl. From Feb. 4, 2007 in Miami.

programme.title: Super Bowl Classics
programme.desc: Head Coach Jon Gruden beat his former team as the Bucs win their first NFL championship, routing the Oakland Raiders 48-21 in the first ever Super Bowl matchup of number one offense vs. number one defense.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Watch the Buffalo Bills vs. Cincinnati Bengals in the 1988 AFC Championship.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: The legendary coach's rise from his Brooklyn youth to the sidelines of Lambeau Field.

programme.title: A Football Life
programme.desc: The final years of his life, from his three-peat in Green Bay to his brief tenure as head coach in Washington and his tragic death from cancer.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The 1994 Montana-Elway matchup in Denver was as close as they come. The two teams had identical scores in each of the first three quarters and the fourth quarter was as competitive as the first three. Kansas City would ultimately come away with a victory off a late touchdown pass from Joe Montana.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: The most incredible plays and clutch moments from Joe Montana's Hall of Fame career.

programme.title: NFL Top 10
programme.desc: A countdown of "Joe Cool's" finest performances.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Randall Cunningham threw three touchdowns, Robert Smith rushed for 124 yards, and Minnesota Vikings's defense forced three turnovers to secure the win and beat the Cardinals 41-21.

programme.title: NFL Deep Dive: How An Undrafted RB Dominated The NFL For 3 Seasons
programme.desc: 18 years ago an undrafted running back named Priest Holmes turned in the greatest 38-game performance in NFL history. In this episode of NFL Deep Dive, we take a look at some the most mind-boggling stats, records, and moments from Holmes' storybook career.

programme.title: Condensed Game
programme.desc: Condensed Game - Houston Texans opened their season in dominant fashion, defeating the Indianapolis Colts 34-24 at home. While Colts quarterback Peyton Manning had 433 passing yards and three touchdowns on 40-of-57 attempts, it wasn't enough to overcome a Texans team that capitalized on big plays and a ground game that couldn't be stopped.

programme.title: 2025 Tewaaraton Award Ceremony
programme.desc: From the Smithsonian National Museum of the American Indian in Washington, DC, comes the 25th annual Tewaaraton Award Ceremony. The prestigious Tewaaraton Award Ceremony honors the top collegiate lacrosse players in the country. Join us for an intimate evening with this year's Tewaaraton Legend Award honorees, Gary and Paul Gait, and the Tewaaraton Spirit Award honorees, Mike and Paul Rabil, and witness history as the 2025 winners are announced and awarded for their outstanding achievements.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Joey Spallina - Paul Carcaterra visits Syracuse, N.Y. to pull back the curtain on the biggest name in College Lacrosse: Joey Spallina. In this episode of THROUGH X, Spallina speaks on wearing the No. 22 at Syracuse, shares his goal to return the Orange to NCAA Championship glory, and shows you how to score his signature behind-the-back goal.

programme.title: For Something Bigger
programme.desc: Alex Aust Holman has been one of the most impactful players in the modern era of women’s lacrosse. Now at the end of her career, she has the opportunity to create her legacy with the Maryland Charm.

programme.title: 2025 Tewaaraton Award Ceremony
programme.desc: From the Smithsonian National Museum of the American Indian in Washington, DC, comes the 25th annual Tewaaraton Award Ceremony. The prestigious Tewaaraton Award Ceremony honors the top collegiate lacrosse players in the country. Join us for an intimate evening with this year's Tewaaraton Legend Award honorees, Gary and Paul Gait, and the Tewaaraton Spirit Award honorees, Mike and Paul Rabil, and witness history as the 2025 winners are announced and awarded for their outstanding achievements.

programme.title: Droppin Bodies
programme.desc: Julia, a mother haunted by a violent past, flees her old life to protect her daughter, Kelsey. But when Kelsey is tragically murdered by her boyfriend, Julia is left shattered and betrayed. Abandoned by a justice system that fails to bring her daughter's killer to account, she's forced to confront the darkness she once escaped.

programme.title: The Good Sister
programme.desc: Raven moves in with her sister Devin and her husband in Atlanta, where she begins to dig her claws into Devin's life and home, and seducing her husband. Devin must make a choice that could be deadly to save her own life and happiness.

programme.title: Taboo 2
programme.desc: Revelations about a woman's disturbing past, and the past of her family members, threaten to tear relationships apart and expose even darker secrets.

programme.title: Taboo 3: The Unforgettable Act
programme.desc: When Devin finally meets his soap star birth mother as an adult, feelings go beyond family love.

programme.title: Sweet Justice
programme.desc: Four women run a private child support clinic by day, but by night they are seductresses who seek out deadbeat parents to make them pay.

programme.title: Sneaky Links
programme.desc: Popular social media influencer, Tammy, vows to take her slutty secrets to the grave until the wrong person finds out and becomes a problem.

programme.title: No Disrespect
programme.desc: Milk runs the streets efficiently in his father's absence. After 15 years in prison, his father, Bull, returns to claim what is rightfully his.

programme.title: Pastor Thorne: Lust of the Flesh
programme.desc: Pastor Thorne has a prominent church and a stellar reputation but, as his fame grows, his moral compass begins to veer more and more off-course.

programme.title: Mama Jones
programme.desc: Following a family tragedy, a grief-stricken matriarch becomes territorial when her son and his girlfriend come home with a surprise.

programme.title: Dangerous Thirst
programme.desc: In an attempt to spice up their marriage, a young couple steps into the sultry world of swinging, but their journey comes at a price.

programme.title: Cuffin Season
programme.desc: When Nate's livelihood becomes dependent on his marital status, he makes it his mission to find a wife in a city where most are single.

programme.title: Clutch
programme.desc: In this dark comedy, a reluctant thief, Martyn (David Hewlett), inadvertently kills a man during the bungled robbery of a rare book. Martyn enlists his friends to get rid of the body, while he delivers the book to a psychotic black market antique dealer. When his car breaks down, he meets Theresa (Tanya Allen), a local mechanic, who tums out to be the girlfriend of the man he has just slain.

programme.title: You Made Me This Way
programme.desc: Haunted by a failed assassination attempt, ruthless drug lord Kwame becomes obsessed with Aubrey, the woman who nearly ended his life. Consumed by revenge, he kidnaps her, setting in motion a deadly game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: The Housekeeper 2
programme.desc: After moving on from her sordid past, Sharease flourishes in her new life and success. When her son Adonis kidnapped, she seeks help from a ghost of her past to rescue him.

programme.title: The Perfect Challenge
programme.desc: Alfred and Della Hughes, a successful couple, face marital strife. Alfred's neglect and an affair strain their bond. Della, overwhelmed by household duties, feels undervalued. Their children witness their parents' escalating conflicts, leading to a tumultuous breakdown. Though their children plead for unity, divorce looms. A family intervention, sparked by a heartfelt gift, forces them to confront their deep-seated love and the possibility of reconciliation.

programme.title: Troubled Mystic
programme.desc: Tracie is a single mother who meets Corey Daniels, the calculated and "perfect guy" looking for his next perfect family to manipulate by any means necessary.

programme.title: Killer Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Jealousy and vengeance threaten to destroy everything Ciera holds dear when she breaks up with the father of her child and moves on with a new man.

programme.title: It Is What It Is
programme.desc: Victoria, a sophisticated young woman, is trying to find happiness with a good man in the midst of drugs and violence in the mean streets of KC.

programme.title: Ice
programme.desc: A young man sets out for revenge against the ruthless gangsters who killed his parents, only to fall for the crime lord’s daughter.

programme.title: Keisha
programme.desc: Struggling to take care of her son and pay bills, Keisha is forced to turn to exotic dancing to keep from sliding deeper into poverty.

programme.title: Home of the Brave
programme.desc: In 1965, Klansmen murder a civil-rights worker named Viola Liuzzo who was driving with a black passenger.

programme.title: Hidden Agenda
programme.desc: When a popular football star dies after an after party, a woman goes on the hunt to find his killer.

programme.title: Hail Mary!
programme.desc: The Maine Lobsters have lost 32 games in a row. So when their coach buys a school of sumo wrestlers to replace his offensive line, all bets are off.

programme.title: For the Gram
programme.desc: Brandi becomes a viral internet model overnight, but an obsession with maintaining her newfound fame and lifestyle creates a social media monster.

programme.title: Busted and Disgusted
programme.desc: Promise is envious of Faith and her success, so she seeks to claim some of that happiness by any means necessary, no matter the cost.

programme.title: Bunny and Clive
programme.desc: A down-and-out reporter gets the scoop of a lifetime when he secures an interview with the notorious crime duo that is holding him hostage.

programme.title: Messy
programme.desc: After being sent away to prison for possessing a firearm, Meek Richardson returns home to the DMV to find out his associate Kevin, is killed. Meek seeks to find the truth about his friend's death, and finds that his enemies are closer than it seems.

programme.title: Thick Trip
programme.desc: Four close-knit friends, all single and yearning for a change, embark on a summer-long 'Queen's Trip' to South Padre, Houston, and the untouched wilderness. As they travel and experience the vibrant cultures and breathtaking landscapes, they confront their fears, rediscover their passions, and explore their own wild sides.

programme.title: The Isiah Factor Uncensored
programme.desc: News anchor and reporter Isiah Carey tackles hot-button news issues with a no-holds-barred attitude.

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqué, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: Late Night Love
programme.desc: Your late-night destination for real talk on love, sex and relationships.

programme.desc: Jacinth Headlam shares her journey of healing and purpose after trauma in this powerful, inspiring memoir.

programme.title: Karamo

programme.desc: "The Corpse Vanishes" (1942) Horror. A mad botanist drains kidnapped brides to keep his 80-year-old wife looking young. With Bela Lugosi, Luana Walters, Elizabeth Russell.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Robot Monster" (1953) Science fiction. Earthlings flee from the Ro-Man, a martian in a gorilla suit with a diving helmet. Originally 3-D. With George Nader, Claudia Barrett, Selena Royle.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Survivors of devastation enter the Power Station to fight the Dark One after billions of robots revolt against humans on New Terra.

programme.title: Cinematic Titanic
programme.desc: Leemoid, Zagatile and Interbyce are aliens whose spaceship has crashed in a small town outside of Baltimore, and soon the townfolk are turning up mutilated and dead.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Manhunt in Space" (1954) Hero Jones (Richard Crane) and crew (Scotty Beckett, Sally Mansfield) join a 21st-century manhunt. From the "Rocky Jones, Space Ranger" TV series.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Emily's crew watch three humans and their robot friend defend the moon colonies in 1979's "The Shape of Things to Come" by H.G. Wells.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Blood Waters of Dr. Z" (1972) Horror. A Florida scientist turns into a walking catfish. With Marshall Grauer and Wade Popwell.

programme.title: Cinematic Titanic
programme.desc: Annabelle says the bugs shall inherit the earth.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Santo invents a time machine that gets him embroiled in the machinations of Dracula.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Jonah and the 'bots endure Munchie, where a kid finds a creature who tries to help him but just gets him in more trouble.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Joe Don Baker tracks down an Italian mobster in Malta while Pearl tries to promote a looser humorous atmosphere in Castle Forrester.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Seeking revenge against those responsible for stripping him of his tenure and the denial of human research subjects, Dr. Z mutates himself into a hideous — and murderous — half-human-half-fish-like creature!

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Village of the Giants." (1965) Science fiction. Teens eat boy-genius's food, grow big and bad; with Johnny Crawford, Ronny Howard.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Gamera" (1966) Science fiction. Only Plan Z can stop a giant, fire-breathing flying turtle roused by an atomic bomb. With Eiji Funakoshi, Harumi Kiritachi, Junichiro Yamashita.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Merlin's Shop of Mystical Wonder" (1996) Fantasy. A medieval wizard and his wife find trouble when they set up shop in the 20th century. With Ernest Borgnine, George Milan, Bunny Summers.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Hellcats" (1969) Crime drama. A slain policeman's brother and girlfriend infiltrate a motorcycle gang of drug smugglers. With Ross Hagen, Dee Duffy, Sharyn Kinzie.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Cave Dwellers" (1984) Science fiction. A prehistoric warrior (Miles O'Keefe) and his sidekick, Thong, protect Earth from the Geometric Nucleus.

programme.title: Cinematic Titanic
programme.desc: American spies discover the Chinese have built a weapon capable of destroying the Earth.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A secret agent tries to stop a drug lord from taking over the world with hallucinogenic chewing gum.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: When a hold-up carried out by his two-bit hoodlum friends goes tragically awry, Eddie Crane’s bright future as a recording artist from the mean streets could be in jeopardy.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "First Spaceship on Venus" (1960) Science fiction. International astronauts go to Venus and find what's left of a race that destroyed itself. With Yoko Tani, Oldrich Lukes, Ignacy Machowski.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Recycled "Battlestar Galactica" footage highlights this story about the struggle for control of a huge space cruiser in "Space Mutiny.".

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Tug of Words
programme.desc: Based on the playground game Tug-O-War, teams of two compete to answer word-clue questions correctly and pull the flag on the tug of war rope to their side.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty contestants take on one of television's largest and most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: You will see how ten celebrities get wet and repeatedly face tough obstacles in order to win the grand final.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Next Level Chef
programme.desc: The world's toughest culinary competition kicks off.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: To become America’s next Junior MASTERCHEF, the top 14 home cooks head to the great outdoors for a chicken cookout. Hungry campers at the KIDS CAMP MASTERCHEF will decide which dish reigns supreme, and the winning team’s recipe will be featured in Family Circle Magazine. The losing team must face a coconut cream pie pressure test that proves to be not as “sweet” as it may seem. Find out who’s MASTERCHEF dreams will go up in flames.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 12 are in for a surprise when the kids from Kidz Bop arrive and put their twist on a mystery box challenge, deciding which ingredients the home cooks must craft into an elevated dish full of personality. Only one will win a huge advantage, forever altering his/or/her MASTERCHEF journey in a “blast from the past” elimination test. Find out who makes it into the Top 10.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Mojito's, a Cuban eatery in Brooklyn. The owners purchased the restaurant as newlyweds, but they are now seven years into a crumbling marriage and business.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay journeys to Ridgewood, New Jersey to rejuvenate Bazzini, an Italian eatery hampered by sluggish service and a lackluster kitchen staff.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: After a shocking elimination, both teams must regroup and chart a new course.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The remaining chefs use cookbooks from Gordon's library to spell out the ingredients they want to use for their next challenge.

programme.title: Next Level Chef
programme.desc: The final three contestants must create dishes on all three levels in 90 minutes.

programme.title: Next Level Chef
programme.desc: The world's toughest culinary competition kicks off.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: It’s a battle to the finish line when the Top 10 are tasked with a pasta race. The home cooks are divided into teams and compete to roll out the longest sheet of pasta as fast as they possibly can. The first team’s pasta sheet to make it to the winner’s circle will be safe and exempt from a high-stakes elimination test in which éclairs are the dish du jour. No detail will go unnoticed.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 10 participate in the season’s most crucial team challenge when the MASTERCHEF JUNIOR restaurant opens its doors to a special group of VIP female role models. The team that dishes up the most impressive meal will go straight into the Top 8, but it’s going to take more than skill to win over this exclusive group of guests. The losing team will face a Gordon Ramsay masterclass in which they will be tasked with replicating a three-Michelin-star-rated dish. See who advances.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As October progresses and nights become colder, Monty advises on what plants need protection and how to protect tender plants over the coming months. Adam Frost travels to Peterborough to find out about the work of a Children in Need project for disadvantaged and vulnerable children.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has ideas for pots which will remain colourful throughout winter, gives tips on how to protect tender banana plants and harvests pumpkins. Frances Tophill helps a viewer whose overgrown pond needs some renovation, Adam Frost visits a garden in Nottinghamshire where the season of winter highlights its design.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A new gardening year begins at Longmeadow and Monty reveals his new plans for the year as well as taking stock of any winter damage. As well as seasonal hints and tips he is embarking on a mission to reduce the use of plastic in his garden and starts by exploring alternative containers to use for seed sowing. Adam Frost brings his design expertise to a tiny back yard to demonstrate that no matter how small, with a bit of ingenuity, every space can count when it comes to gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going in his vegetable garden sowing seeds for a bountiful summer and growing some more unusual vegetables as well as recommending varieties of summer bulbs to plant in spring. Plus, Mark Lane creates a floral celebration in a container.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With bees in mind, Monty Don plans for spring by planting some early nectar sources for them, using bulbs which flower early in the year, namely crocus and winter aconites. He also selects some asters which will not only give colour for autumn but will also help bees build up their nectar reserves to help them survive the winter. Plus, Carol Klein is in Norfolk at Pensthorpe Nature Reserve.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at RHS Garden Wisley in Surrey to learn from the experts there how easy alpines are to grow, which seeds are needed to plant a wildflower meadow and the best orchids to grow for each room in the house. Meanwhile, Carol Klein helps Britain in Bloom volunteer Michael Welsh, who is determined to bring colour to the former colliery town of Easington with a community garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Earlier in the year Monty put aside a patch of his garden to grow his own cut flowers and this week he returns to assess the results and harvest his first crop of colourful blooms. We pay a visit to an organic flower farm to find out how, from seed to harvest, the process of growing plays a large part in improving well-being.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty demonstrates that it is not too late to start growing vegetables by showing us which types to sow now, and adds some summer colour to the Spring Garden by sinking plants in pots into the borders. We meet a hosta National Collection holder, who shares the secrets of his propagating success, and Rachel de Thame pays a visit to the garden of theatre impresario Sir Cameron Mackintosh.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows us how to plant pots of bulbs for fabulous summer colour. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is out and about looking at native celandines, Wordsworth's favourite flower. They grace our hedgerows and woods at this time of year. The wild strains are too invasive for most domestic gardens, but Carol finds a number of cultivated varieties that should suit most of us.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Despite the slow awakening of the garden, there are still plenty of jobs to be getting on with and Monty begins to divide ornamental grasses, gives advice on what to do with containers which are past their best, plants up a colourful alpine trough and gives advice on what to sow now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Celebrate the very best of spring gardening with Monty at Longmeadow, and visit the RHS Malvern Spring Festival to see 2018's hottest garden designs and the season's must-have plants. At Longmeadow, Monty plants herbaceous perennials for summer colour and gives advice on how to care for carnivorous plants, Frances Tophill catches up with the growing trend for greening up indoor spaces with house plants, and meet the third finalist in the Every Space Counts competition.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty elevates his cottage garden borders by adding plants to give height and drama, and rejuvenates the design of the grass borders by adding evergreen plants grown from cuttings. Carol Klein's plant of the season is the delicate but easy to grow dog's tooth violet, Joe Swift travels to the Trellisick garden in Cornwall to meet a very special garden volunteer and Adam Frost returns to Leicestershire to monitor the progress of the new build garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With summer on the horizon, Monty is planting up pots for summer colour as well as giving his box hedging a seasonal cut. Frances Tophill checks on the progress of the crops on her shared allotment, Mark Lane is in Suffolk where he gives advice on the elements of successful woodland planting design and Nick Bailey travels to a garden in Cheshire to answer a viewer's query about how to plant up a rocky area of their garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's warm enough for all the tender plants to go out into the garden now and at Longmeadow Monty finds places in his borders for bananas and dahlias whilst, in the vegetable garden, courgettes and tomatoes are planted out. At the RHS Chatsworth show in Derbyshire Nick Bailey, Carol Klein and Joe Swift explore the showground to find the best of the plants and show gardens that the exhibitors have to offer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Spring gets into its stride and Longmeadow is bursting into life. Monty Don prepares for the summer by direct sowing hardy annuals like nasturtiums and calendulas as well as planting barley to give a flush of golden colour in the summer months. Monty also introduces us to the walled garden, an intimate family space where he'll be doing some timely lawn repair. Carol Klein visits the Gibberd Garden in Harlow.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As spring gets well underway, Monty Don adds to his collection of fritillaries at Longmeadow with pot-grown plants, as well as sowing some from seed. He also recommends other wildflowers which would thrive in the garden. Carol Klein meets Matt Bishop, who explains why he is attracted to later flowering varieties of daffodils and Rachel de Thame shows a viewer how to get to grips with pruning an overgrown shrubbery.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has advice on how to successfully store an apple crop so it will last through winter and explains why he thinks it high time wall flowers came back into fashion. With tomatoes now over, Monty clears his greenhouse and plans for next year by planting garlic in the vegetable garden. Meanwhile, Carol is home at Glebe Cottage, dividing her perennials to continue the cost-effective stocking of her new beds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost and Joe Swift take a close look at all the show gardens for fresh ideas as well as inspiration, Mark Lane finds planting ideas around the showground and Carol and Nick explore the floral marquee. They also meet the designers whose innovative ideas have resulted in a showgarden made from scrap iron and junk shop finds, go behind the scenes to visit the nurseries who bring their best specimens to the show.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP DeRose and his tournament partner's daughter, Caylan target White Sturgeon in British Columbia

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Follow the DCD crew as they head North to hunt with duck call maker Brad Eldrige. Despite tough hunting conditions brought on by a historic drought in Louisiana, the crew is able to knock down a “Tensas Limit” of wood ducks, mallards, honkers, and squirrels.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is in Columbia, South Carolina, fishing with Captain Justin McGrady for the elusive freshwater Striped Bass.

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is passionate about catching the mighty Sailfish, andgoes out with his tournament partner and former MLB star, Doug Mankietwicz. Doug has won a World Series and Olympic Gold medal, and now is in search of some Sails.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Renowned angler Meredith McCord and Capt. Justin Leake continue their quest for a line class world record. When struggles begin the moment they leave the dock, grit and lady luck ensure an epic day ends in grand style.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Last year was chaotic but it wouldn’t be right if we didn’t try to throw a wrench into our plans once again. Ladies and gentlemen, welcome to the Dirty Bird.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling “The River Farm” they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With a laundry list of things to do on the Dirty Bird, Randy finds himself in a pickle when Cody just up and disappears.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With the King of the Raven in full swing, Randy decides to have a doe challenge to close out the season. With a bunch of buddies coming into camp this next week is about to be full of Surprises.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are all hands-on deck at the Raven. Things are coming down to the wire with bow season just around the corner. With just over a week left they are trying to get everything wrapped up before the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff embark on a 20-day mission into the Everglades to find the invasive pythons that are plaguing the ecosystem. These apex predators have eliminated more than 90% of fur-bearing animals in their new home. Can they turn the tide, or is the Everglades already lost?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. Learn from the Chickasaw Nation about the history of this method that has been used by Native Americans for thousands of years.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaii’s coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Hunter Smallback into the Everglades for some snook fishing, and the action really heats up when some hungry Lemon sharks crash the party.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor catch two thirds of a slam when they bring Tom’s new Yellowfin 24’ Bay up to Key Largo for some exciting flats fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Captain Mason Baker to sample some early morning Islamorada backcountry baby tarpon action.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: After a successful morning of baby tarpon fishing, Captains Tom Rowland, Rich Tudor and Mason Baker slide over to the legendary downtown Islamorada flats to check on the resurgence of Florida Keys bonefish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head into the Everglades backcountry out of Key Largo to fish the shallow grass flats for tailing redfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Saltwater Experience Charters’ Captain Garrett Stephens for a trip into the Gulf. When their catches get repeatedly cut off, they decide to bring the massive bull sharks up to the surface for a closer look.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is in Columbia, South Carolina, fishing with Captain Justin McGrady for the elusive freshwater Striped Bass.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Florida, where we stop in Jacksonville, Jupiter, Boca Raton and Miami!!

programme.title: Destination Polaris
programme.desc: Host Jared Christie travels to Las Vegas to strike it rich on the trails.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway Shaynna Blaze discovers the joys of a European summer cruising along the Rhine, Main and Danube rivers.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway; Shaynna Blaze continues her summer escape to Europe as she cruises through Germany and into Austria.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaii’s coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: After adventuring around the USA Danny decided to compete in a good old fashioned Bass Tournament in his home town.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: In Valle de Elqui, Chile, the Canihuante family and their community have banded together to combat the harmful effects of long-standing mining practices in the region. Their mission: convince the Chilean government to permanently protect the Cochiguaz River, a vital resource for locals and myriad fauna and flora that depend on its water for survival.

programme.title: On Deck
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late."Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From country music star Brian Kelley’s big 56’ Sunny Briggs Sportfishing Yacht, to getting caught in a storm aboard a small Hurricane deck boat in the Gulf of Mexico, this episode of Stomping Grounds has host Ryan McVinney exploring boat culture in Florida’s Panhandle region, from the Emerald Coast to The Big Bend and the Forgotten Coast. Brian Kelley, aka “Beach Cowboy”, or BK for short, makes up one half of the country music group Florida Georgia Line (FGL) and has just released his own solo album Sunshine State of Mind. Kelley invites viewers aboard his vessel the “Brittney Marie” which was named after his wife, for a look at the couple’s Stomping Grounds. Songs from his album play on the boat’s sound system - including a tune about shopping for a boat on Boat Trader

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark is still on the South Island of New Zealand chasing the Wingshooting Slam. It’s Mark's last day to complete the waterfowl portion of the slam and he still needs a Black Swan and a Shoveler. This hunt is taking place on a freshwater lake right off the ocean. The temperature is unusually warm for this time of year, but thankfully that hasn’t affected the numbers of birds around.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is south of the border in Veracruz, Mexico going after a Mexican Gulf Coast Whitetail. When the whitetail action slowed down, Mark tried his luck at a spot-and stalk hunt for White-lipped Peccary. With hot temps, Mark and company try to find water that the Peccary will be targeting to stay hydrated.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Captain Josh and the fam head out to do some surf fishing to see what’s biting. Then ended the day building professional sand castles and playing goofy golf.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Over the years we have been able to hunt with a lot of amazing people. This episode takes us to Las Palmas ranch to hunt with Payton Angelle. Payton was awarded this hunt from the amazing people over at Sky High for kids.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This week our team visits The Rocky Creek Ranch with two long time supporters of TTHA, Blake Barnett and John Fink. The goal in this episode is white management, which is something both Blake and John are passionate about. Blake has been hunting many years but what takes place in this hunt is a first.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: This is the story of how FE Hill ranch got it's start. From its inception, FE Hill has created opportunities for people to experience the outdoors and create memories. For us, it has created a tradition of Fathers and Sons hunting together.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In our final episode in Japan, the DIRT team went road-tripping through beautiful, snowy Japanese landscapes—and tasting everything in sight. A crown jewel in the northeast corner of Japan, Hokkaido may be famous among skiers and snowboarders for the luscious "Japow," but way beyond the tourist trail there's a burgeoning new food scene and a unique and vibrant history. Though, if we're honest, Josh probably could've spent the whole trip carving up the mountain and been a happy camper.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Episode one hits close to home. Specifically, Josh’s hometown of Seattle where we travel from the mountains to the coast in pursuit of local ingredients for an authentic Washington meal. Digging for forest delicacies, hunting for exotic bivalves, and exploring the tidal flats of a multi-generational shellfish farm—it’s all on the menu.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouri’s gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the “Show Me” state in search of mature whitetail bucks. For Nikki Boxler and the Winchester Deer Camp, it’s no different. With Winchester’s in hand, Nikki and crew play cat and mouse with several mature bucks at Indian Hill Outfitters in Pike County.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Every season, just like clockwork, mission-driven longboards gobble their way across the plains of South Dakota, the cornfields of Iowa, the timbered ridges of Michigan and the cattle ground of Kansas looking for their soulmates in one of the most celebrated hunting seasons in America…the wild turkey breeding season. Join Team Winchester as they stalk, call, flank and roost boss gobblers into range from coast to coast.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Everything is bigger in Texas, including the stories. With the whitetail rut in the midwest winding down, the Winchester Life Crew of Chris Keefer, Casey Keefer, Nikki Boxler and Paul Sawyer head south to the Texas Panhandle with Winchesters in hand hoping to wrangle in a few Texas-sized giants.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The positive impact made by the shooting sports and recreational shooting to people across our country can’t be measured in just one story, so we have three. In Florida, Olympian Dania Vizzi trains at her home shooting facility and talk about how she went from ballerina to one of the best shotgun shooters in the world. In Nebraska, firearms instructor Thea Van Syoc has used the disciplines of competitive pistol shooting and training to help shape her life. Finally we’ll take a look into the National African American Gun Association and learn how one day at the range for Phillip Smith created the fastest growing firearm organization in the United States.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interlux’s paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is taking the Marine Surplus Console for the Aqua sport project and giving it a much needed face lift. They meet the team at Boat Outfitters to find an acrylic covering board to fit the console and cover the pre existing holes. They then head over to meet with crew at AwlGrip to get some ideas on color matching the console with the Aqua sport.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade takes us around the hometown hunting grounds and shows us some of the last bits of preparation for the season. An old buck that’s been showing up on camera at night decides to daylight and pays the price.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: On this weeks episode of Hunting Land Man, Slade and his daughter Asa take on the turkey woods together for the first time. As this is Asa's first time turkey hunting some quick pre hunt preparations are in order. Slade also was able to sit down with a good friend and registered forester to talk fire and the benefits of fire in land management. The next day, Asa and Slade were able to connect with a thundering tom as Asa punched her first ever turkey tag!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade gets very busy in the real estate world. But lucky for him, Caleb Armstrong takes up the slack. Caleb sets out to hunt swamp bucks on the public land of Tensas Parish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson set off to hunt the American Alligator in eastern Texas. A species that was placed on the endangered species list in the 1960s, their populations are now thriving. Kyle and Jeff have agreed to help remove some problem gators off private land owned by their friend Troy, but things get rowdy when Kyle loses a bet and has to swim with the very gators he is hunting.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Florida, where we stop in Jacksonville, Jupiter, Boca Raton and Miami!!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, hunting season swiftly coming to an end. Withthe real estate world getting busier, Slade and his family set outto fill some tags, and fill up the freezer. It’s time to go on a DoePatrol!

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield of All Things Hunting and Willi Schmidt of Pure Hunting share their personal stories of how hunting has been an integral part of their lives, passed down through generations. While their beginnings and experiences are very different, they find common ground in the heritage of Browning Firearms with memorable whitetail hunts in Louisiana and Montana.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Aoudad Country Part 2- Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things hunting head to the Texas and Mexico border on a DIY Aoudad hunt where Cole is after his first Aoudad. After that Kyle teams up with good friend Chris Griffin where they head to another Ranch on the border and hunt two giant Aoudad rams with a rifles.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: It's Rifle Season in Oklahoma. Kyle Barefield and wife, Stevie Barefield are hunting the rut for big western bucks with the brand new X-Bolt 2 Rifle from Browning. A front blows in, and with the change in weather, 2 big whitetails go down.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents

It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didn’t just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys – and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.
