programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, the FBI began a massive undercover operation, code named Safebet, that was designed to expose the Chicago Mafia's infiltration into the city's surrounding suburbs. Undercover agents quickly discovered that the mob had its tentacles spread into every facet of the law enforcement community. They unwittingly uncovered the murder of a wealthy socialite perpetrated by a jealous and greedy mob lawyer and covered up by the local police chief.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man tells police he shot an intruder who had attacked and murdered his wife. The husband paints a tragic picture and is dubbed a hero. Four years later, forensic evidence leads police to re-examine the motives of this so-called hero.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1987 disappearance of Houston resident Tracy Jo Shine is recalled. The investigation went cold until 2000 when a 'cold case squad' learned that the woman's ex-boyfriend Michael Neal had bragged about killing her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigators sift through the ashes of a fire which killed a 40-year-old woman. The fire appeared to have been started by an unattended cigarette. On closer look, forensic scientists discover the cause was far more complicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bruce Miller was shot to death in the office of the junkyard business he owned. The crime scene was almost pristine. When a computer forensics expert examined the computers owned by the victim's wife and her lover, he found all the evidence needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mysterious computer crash pushed a thriving manufacturing company to the brink of collapse, jeopardizing hundreds of employees' jobs. Forensic investigators must determine if the crash was the result of a computer defect, human error, or sabotage.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a 6-year-old disappears, her father becomes the prime suspect; he fails a polygraph test and even confesses, but 10 years later, the investigation gets turned on its head.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1962, the people of the small town of Hanford, California lost their sense of peace when one of their own, 15-year-old Marlene Miller, was murdered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the first time animal DNA was used to solve a criminal case. When the body of Douglas Beamish's estranged wife Shirley Duguay was discovered, authorities linked 20 cat hairs found on her jacket to a cat owned by Beamish's parents.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2002, a small community in upstate New York was devastated when Patty Wlasiuk died in a truck accident. But burdock seed pods found in her hair and on her clothes would indicate that this was no accident. It was cold-blooded murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic scientists work with the only clue recovered from a multiple-victim shooting: a 12-gauge shotgun. Scientists use unique methods to lift the serial number from the weapon in order to trace it to its owner.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man tells police he shot an intruder who had attacked and murdered his wife. The husband paints a tragic picture and is dubbed a hero. Four years later, forensic evidence leads police to re-examine the motives of this so-called hero.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: No one in a quiet residential community saw anything unusual the day one of their neighbors was brutally attacked and murdered. Fingerprints found at the crime scene and surveillance video helped investigators to apprehend the presumed killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an 11-year-old girl disappeared from a small town in a remote area of Alaska, investigators wondered if she'd been attacked by a bear or become lost in the dense woods. It turned out neither was true.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For years, a woman suffered from what appeared to be the unpleasant side effects of lithium, a drug prescribed to treat bipolar disorder. When she died, investigators had to determine if her death was due to natural causes, suicide, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Residents of Noel, Missouri were stunned to learn that their bank had been robbed and the bank president was missing. His body was later found floating in a lake, securely bound to a chair with duct tape.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women from the same town were murdered in the same way, police feared a serial killer was on the loose. At first they thought the victims had nothing in common until they found tiny clues linking them to the same man.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A healthy young man dies mysteriously in his sleep, and toxicology tests reveal a lethal dose of lidocaine in his blood. Investigators find a suicide note, and presume he killed himself until a forensic linguist examines the note.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors cannot pinpoint the source of a businessman's illness.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman disappears without a trace. Even though foul play is suspected, the leads don't pan out and the trail turns cold. Twenty years would pass before police are able to link a clump of hair discovered in an isolated area with the missing woman.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1984, California firefighters had battled ten arson fires in three weeks. When cigarettes and a scrap of paper connected the southern California fires to several fires further north, the hunt was on for a dangerous pyromaniac.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial arsonist was on the loose in Washington, DC. Each of the fires was started with the same type of incendiary device. It was up to forensic scientists to find the clues that lay in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of 16-year-old Leanne Tiernan was discovered nine months after she disappeared. Forensic scientists found clues that painted a virtual portrait of her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A patrol officer is shocked by the amount of blood at a traffic accident and is shocked by the coroner's ruling until an anonymous phone call re-ignites the case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a young woman was found under an isolated ramp of the Interstate, and a tiny, unique fiber on the victim's clothing led San Diego police straight to the most unlikely of killers.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A mother of two young children was found dead in her bedroom. Her death was ruled a suicide _ but when investigators learned she had almost died in a house fire three years earlier, they decided to take another look at the evidence.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Exploring how an American hit single from 1966 -- "The Cheater" by Bob Kuban and the In-Men -- foreshadowed the demise of the group's lead singer, Walter Scott.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A two-man shrimp boat sank when a fast-moving, violent storm struck the Louisiana coast. The captain drowned, and the deckhand was rescued fourteen hours later. The deckhand was considered a hero until the captain's body was found.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind _ tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A neighbor watched as a man stabbed his wife, pushed her into the swimming pool and held her head under water. The husband, however, had no recollection of the crime. A jury would have to decide between evidence and the mysteries of the mind.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a wealthy real estate tycoon went missing, it appeared to be foul play. In his will, he left instructions regarding what was to happen if he died under violent circumstances_which were carried out after a hiker came across a bullet-ridden skull.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police are dispatched to the scene of a shooting, and discover the victim's husband is one of their own: a homicide detective who says his wife accidentally shot herself in the head.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When hunters found a skull in a Texas canyon, police found bits of clothing, small bones and a strand of hair. A forensic artist reconstructed her face. Now all they had to do was find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.desc: In the summer of 1986, Kathleen Lipscomb's body was found on a deserted road outside of San Antonio. Months passed, then years, and the crime was never solved. Then Kathleen's family hired a private investigator, who discovered her diary.

programme.desc: A man disappears one year to the day after beginning an affair with his friend's wife. 15 years later, with the help of a metal detector, police found evidence which would prove what had happened, and who was responsible.

programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.desc: An Alaskan police officer found a woman's body while on routine patrol of a public park. The victim had been stabbed to death and, during the autopsy, the medical examiner preserved the portion of her rib cage which sustained the fatal wound.

programme.desc: A union official is executed in his home not long after a strike by the union membership. Neither his wife nor anyone in the neighborhood heard any gunshots. It would take a forensic sound test, an electron microscope, and a nightgown to explain why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Modesto, California teenager went missing. There was no sign of a struggle in her home, and police suspected she'd simply run away until her naked, bruised body was discovered in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Investigators sift through the ashes of a fire which killed a 40-year-old woman. The fire appeared to have been started by an unattended cigarette. On closer look, forensic scientists discover the cause was far more complicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bruce Miller was shot to death in the office of the junkyard business he owned. The crime scene was almost pristine. When a computer forensics expert examined the computers owned by the victim's wife and her lover, he found all the evidence needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A drive-by shooting leaves one man dead and another seriously wounded. Cell phone calls and shell casings point to a suspect, but authorities are unable to place him at the crime scene. A forensic geologist proves that dirt is anything but dumb.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In Pennsylvania 1984, a passer-by finds the torso of a woman in a cardboard box. Investigators rely on insect activity analysis by a forensic entomologist to determine when the murder victim was killed.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: At a murder scene, investigators find a shoe-print, several foreign hairs, and unknown fingerprints. But they believe the most telling piece of evidence is the bite mark on the victim's chest.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman suddenly becomes critically ill, eventually leaving her unable to walk. A bone marrow test reveals the cause: arsenic. Investigators must determine if the poisoning was caused by groundwater contamination or something more sinister.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of an eccentric millionaire was not entirely unexpected; he flaunted his wealth and cared little for personal security. The evidence at the crime seemed to indicate robbery, but investigators wondered if there was something more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two men were murdered while sleeping in their beds. The next night, arson destroyed a family planning clinic. Investigators wonder whether some shards of glass, paint chips and a chicken feather could link what appeared to be two separate crimes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, when the wife of a serviceman was brutally murdered in the Philippines, investigators had to reassemble a 5-1/4 inch computer disk which had been cut to pieces with pinking shears in order to find the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A children's magic show goes horribly wrong when one of the performers dies during a trick. Barnaby and Jones discover that the victim was poisoned with a rare toxin extracted from Ecuadorean poison frogs - so the hunt is on for a particularly ruthless and imaginative killer. The detectives soon learn that a feud is raging between local occult practitioner Ernest Balliol and famous writer Aloysius Wilmington. While some of the villagers - such as Ernest's daughter Isolde - believe that powerful magical forces are at play, others think the reasons for the bloodshed may have their roots in the distant past. Barnaby and Jones soon find themselves delving into the occult, magic, and ancients books of power, to determine what happened, and soon sense a mixture of both might be the motive for the murder, when a book shop owner is killed with shattered glass, laced in the same poison.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: Dallas

programme.desc: John Ross decides to move into Southfork. Rebecca approaches Bobby and Christopher with information that she believes might help save the ranch. MITCH PILEGGI guest stars.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Rebecca reveals a life-changing secret to Elena. Meanwhile, John Ross tries to turn one family member against another and a family associate is murdered.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Christopher moves closer to his dream when a large oil company approaches him about rights to new methane technology. And the Ewings fight to protect Southfork from outsiders.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross learns the value of family when he must choose between blood and oil. Sue Ellen and Rebecca both find themselves victims of men who could destroy their lives.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: In the dramatic season one finale, Christopher and Elena begin to learn that not everyone is as they appear to be. Long-buried secrets are revealed as the past rears its ugly head.

programme.title: Dallas

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Pamela Rebecca Barnes schemes with John Ross to fulfill her father's desire for revenge. Ryland's mother (JUDITH LIGHT) proves just as evil as her son.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Pamela pushes her father's agenda to gain control of Ewing Energies. As a new member of the family arrives at Southfork, Ann is pushed to the brink by Ryland's sadistic games.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: J.R. works to undermine Pamela, forcing John Ross to choose between a Ewing and a Barnes. Cliff Barnes (KEN KERCHEVAL) returns to meet with an unlikely visitor.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: John Ross' plot to take over Ewing Energies solidifies; Christopher changes tactics with Pamela Barnes; and an enemy from the Ewings' past resurfaces.

programme.title: Dallas

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: J.R. Ewing finally meets his end. The family strives to set aside their differences and mourn together. Accompanied by many characters from J.R.'s past, the Ewings bury their own.

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: Bobby, Christopher and John Ross work on J.R.'s masterpiece. J.R.'s will has lasting effects on the family legacy. Sue Ellen tries to get Gary (TED SHACKELFORD) out of Dallas.

programme.title: Dallas

programme.title: Dallas
programme.desc: In the electrifying second season finale, the Ewings unite to execute J.R.'s master plan and the shocking answer to the question "Who killed J.R.?" is finally revealed.

programme.title: Dallas

programme.title: Dallas

programme.desc: John Ross scrambles to keep the Arctic lease deal alive, even if he must betray those who love him most. Ryland's plot to keep Emma and John Ross apart takes an unexpected turn.

programme.title: Dallas

programme.title: Dallas

programme.title: LiveNOW from FOX
programme.desc: LiveNOW gives you today's breaking news, live events and stories taking place across the nation.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: The brutal murders of two trans women of color just 48 hours apart in New Orleans unsettle the community, leaving many wondering if the cases are connected. Detectives uncover clues, yet justice remains elusive.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Frank Nicotero quizzes people about real news stories with unreal outcomes for a chance to win money. In "Surprising Sights," contestants learn about a strange seal rescue, a bizarre landmark and a wild wedding prank.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A teen murdered but no suspects. A woman allegedly killed by a panhandler

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Manny Hernandez of Barrels and Boards in Raynham pushes the pace against Chef Ryan Dziki of Wild Fox Pierogi. Will the chefs be able to identify the right ingredients and replicate each other’s sauces before the clock runs out?

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nation’s largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand… or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, America’s native spirit.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Master bartender Kate Gerwin visits Kansas City to talk whiskey, taste the nonalcoholic future at an innovative new bar, experience jazz at the Mutual Musicians Foundation, and learn all about Prohibition in the city that ignored it best.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Former teacher Craig Falk is hitting the (cook)books against former lawyer Laurie Boucher. Which of these second-career chefs best showcases their culinary skills to craft the perfect packed lunch?

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: Inspiring girls to elevate their voices and express themselves through art.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: Forging fine knives for the chef to the outdoorsman.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: It's the war on I-4! In a clash of the traditional and the experimental, The Milk District takes on Lake Buena Vista. Will Chef Ian Russell of Smoke & Donuts bring the heat or will Chef Norberto of El Patron smoke the competition?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Miranda, a 24-year-old mechanical engineer was diagnosed with MS. Determined not to let MS dim her zest for life, Miranda and Kinga set out to find the outdoor fun in and around Cincinnati.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: From cycling on a party boat to practicing yoga in the great outdoors, Rob discovers that Boston’s newest neighborhood is full of surprises.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin and Ryan fly 3,000 miles to visit the “Mouth Ninja," a paralyzed artist who makes incredible drawings using only his mouth. Jimmy Luv and Davin lead the band in an epic ghost hunting adventure inside a haunted building.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: All across this country, people are stepping up to help their communities in big and small ways. From nurses, veterans and firefighters, to teachers, neighbors, and strangers, every community has a hero.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A 12-year-old paperboy's disappearance during his Sunday morning route shocks a peaceful Iowa city. Panic sets in when a second paperboy goes missing.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Whether it’s gathering thousands of mysterious, colorful packets stuffed in a store’s ceiling or valuable wildlife slithering to freedom, investigators must be ready to decisively face a range of mammoth tasks in the field.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they won’t give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: Grit of Greenwood
programme.desc: Greenwood was a thriving Black district in Tulsa when, 100 years ago, it was destroyed in less than 24 hours.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: New Hampshire Chronicle highlights the people and places that make the Granite State so special. Presented by WMUR.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Host Dave Holmes meets celebrity guests at the airport bar to discuss must-do activities in cities across America. So when you’re ready to board your next flight, you’ll have an Esquire-approved itinerary.

programme.title: Always Remember Your Name
programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy

programme.title: Plate It!

programme.title: Eat Play Stay

programme.title: Local Love

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Love is all around us when you take the time to look. Whether it’s a couple still falling in love, or a community organizer making sure every child has a birthday party, there are heartwarming stories all across this country.

programme.title: The Witnesses And The Letter
programme.desc: A couple's vacation plans are thwarted when they find out their flight is cancelled. They return home to find their home taken over by intruders – and are bound, gagged and beaten by the thieves. Only one survives the weekend, and manages to escape to tell their story.

programme.title: The Last Supper
programme.desc: An Arizona couple can't agree on how to spend their retirement savings, and neither one will budge without getting what they want. But the bickering ends tragically when a hitman shoots the couple's pickup truck right in broad daylight outside a restaurant, killing one of them. The survivor is too distraught to remember many details about the attack, and years go by until police plant a fake story to try to catch the killer.

programme.title: Murder In Motown
programme.desc: A young, wealthy Detroit, Michigan couple argues over the wife's career and the husband's stay-at-home duties. One night, the fighting ends when the wife storms off, never to return. The husband pleads for the public's help in finding his wife – desperate for any help or leads. But when the family's nanny calls in a shocking tip, the investigation is turned upside down.

programme.title: Folsom Wolves
programme.desc: A series of random killings in Redlands, California leaves police with no clues. But then the manager of a fast food restaurant finds the ID of one victim in the trash. And with it, another ID which leads to a suspect. So begins a manhunt for a husband and wife biker couple who seek pleasure from the murder of innocent women.
